questions.question: I have ……………………….. respect for him.
questions.description: Great is mainly used with abstract nouns.

questions.question: She has got rather ………………………….. eyes.
questions.description: Big and large are mainly used with concrete nouns.

questions.question: I …………………………….. a book from my sister.
questions.description: We borrow something from somebody. Loan has a similar meaning.

questions.question: ……………………………… me your pen for a minute, will you?
The job was hard but I …………………………… got used to it.
questions.description: Soon means ‘a short time after then’.

questions.question: ……………………………… that week, something suspicious occurred.
questions.description: Early means near the beginning of the time period that we are talking or thinking about.

questions.question: The train arrived 30 minutes ……………………………
questions.description: Early means before the expected time.

questions.question: My watch is five minutes …………………………..
questions.description: A watch or a clock can be fast or slow.

questions.question: Do something ……………………………. He is bleeding.
questions.description: Quickly indicates the need to act urgently.

questions.question: I’m afraid it will take ……………………………… to repair the car.
questions.description: Some time means quite a lot of time.
